#Text=Blake Aaron
#Text=Blake hosting the Blake Aaron Radio Show
#Text=Blake Aaron is a guitarist , composer , recording artist and radio show host .
#Text=As a composer

#Text=Aaron is also an LA-based session guitarist , TV and film composer and has been the guitarist and/or composed for such television shows and films as MADtv where he was the show 's guitarist for 14 years and co-composed the show 's latest theme , Half Past Dead 2 , ( Steven Seagal )

#Text=Super Dave Osborne ( Spike TV ) , co-composed the show 's latest theme , Chocolate News ( Comedy Central ) , The Next Best Thing ( ABC ) , The Starlet ( w/ Faye Dunaway ) ( UPN ) , 10-8 ( ABC ) , The Jamie Kennedy Experiment ( WB ) , Gary and Mike ( UPN ) , The Ben Stiller Show ( FOX ) , Sunday Night Comics ( FOX )
#Text=Solo music career
#Text=The debut release from Blake Aaron on Innervision Records , With Every Touch 2001 , included guest appearances by Eric Marienthal and David Benoit .
#Text=Three singles from this CD stayed in the Top 50 on the Gavin/SmoothJazz.com charts for 8 weeks each .

#Text=" She 's So Fine , " the first single from his second album , Bringin ' It Back 2004 , moved Blake into the forefront of smooth jazz by remaining in the Top 30 on the Radio and Records charts for 8 straight weeks .
#Text=Two of the sophomore effort 's singles reached a spot in the Top 100 of the year on the R&R charts .
#Text=In 2007 , Blake recorded and released his third Innervision CD , Desire .
#Text=Singles included " Bumpin ' on the Wes Side , " and " Desire , " The Desire CD was in the Top 20 on the Radio and Records charts for 15 weeks , and No.1 on the Indie Charts for 20 weeks .
#Text=The latest single " Encantadora , " was No.6 on Billboard and No.1 on the BDS/ Billboard charts .
#Text=It was No.13 for the entire year of 2011 .

#Text=Blake Aaron 's Desire CD has received international airplay on stations such as KTWV The Wave Los Angeles , WQCD New York , KIFM San Diego , KKSF San Francisco , WNUA Chicago , KWJZ Seattle , WLOQ Orlando , 105.7 " The Oasis "
#Text=Las Vegas , KJCD Denver , WJZZ Atlanta , WMAL-FM , Washington D.C.
#Text=The Blake Aaron Radio Show
#Text=In 2008 , Blake Aaron began hosting an internationally syndicated weekly radio show with Tina Anderson ( Mark and Brian Show ) recorded live from host station KSBR .

#Text=Guests have included Alan Parsons , Ambrosia , Anita Baker , Bill Medley , Boney James , Caleb Quaye , Chieli Minucci , Craig Chaquico , Evelyn Champagne King , Frank Stallone , Freddie Fox , Freddie Washington , Hiroshima , Jackiem Joyner , Jessy J , Kenny Loggins , Mindi Abair , Najee , Neal Schon , Nils Lofgren , Paul Jackson Jr. , Peter White , Ricky Lawson , Spencer Day , UNam , and Yes .
#Text=Collaborations

#Text=Aaron has worked with Bernie Worrell , Bill Laswell , Billy Bass , Bobby Womack , Carlos Santana , David Benoit , Dynasty , Eric Marienthal , Fish , Fishbone , Frank Stallone , Gloria Trevi , Hiroshima , Joe Houston , Kuh Ledesma , Lakeside , Little Anthony and the Imperials , Marion Meadows , Mary Wells , Najee , Nelson Rangell , Philip Bailey , Ricky Lawson , Sheila E. , Steve Reid , The Coasters , The Drifters , and The Gap Band .
